artciles.q: The deviator stress developed in the proving ring, through the applied pressure is equal to
artciles.description:
The vertical stress applied by the loading frame, through the proving ring is equal to (σ1 – σ3),
            this stress difference is called the deviator stress.

artciles.q: Which of the following is an advantage of using tri axial test?
option: The plane of shear failure is predetermined
artciles.description:
In tri axial test, precise measurements of the pore pressure and
            volume change during the test are possible.

artciles.q:
In which test variation cell pressure is applied without allowing drainage. Then keeping cell pressure constant,
            deviator stress is increased to failure without drainage.?
artciles.description: None

artciles.q: Bishop’s apparatus does not contain which one of the following equipment?
artciles.description:
Bishop’s apparatus mainly consists of the null indicator,
            the control cylinder, pressure gauge, mercury manometer and burette.

artciles.q: The Tri axial compression test was introduced by
artciles.description: The tri axial compression test was first introduced in U.S.A by A. casagrande and Karl Terzaghi in 1936-37.

artciles.q: Triaxial test has many advantages over the direct shear test
artciles.description: The soil samples are subjected to uniform stresses and strains, Drained and undrained tests can be carried out.

artciles.q: Which of the following strength test is commonly used in the laboratory?
artciles.description:
As a shear test can be performed under all three drainage condition,
              tri axial test is most commonly used in research laboratory.

artciles.q: Which of the following outlet is provided at the base of the tri axial test apparatus?
artciles.description:
Three outlet connections are generally provided through the base of the test apparatus: cell fluid test,
            pore water outlet from the bottom of the specimen and the drainage outlet from the bottom of the specimen.

artciles.q: Pore pressure developed in the tri axial test can be measured by
artciles.description:
Pore pressure developed in the specimen during the test can be measured with the help of a 
            separate pore pressure measuring equipment such a Bishop’s pore pressure apparatus developed by Bishop in 1950, 1961.

artciles.q: The vertical stress on the solid cylindrical test apparatus is applied by
artciles.description:
In tri axial test, the major principle stress σ1 is applied in the vertical direction, and the other two principal stresses
            σ and σ are applied in the horizontal direction by the fluid pressure round the specimen.

artciles.q: When the sol is in the state of stress, it is said to be in
artciles.description:
When the soil is in the state of stress defined by the equation σ1’= σ3’tan2 α’ + 2c’ tan α’ as principal
            stress relationship, it is said to be in plastic equilibrium.

artciles.q: The deviator stress σd is given by
artciles.description:
The deviator stress σd, is given as the ratio of additional axial 
            load to the area A2 at failure or during at any stage of the test.

artciles.q: Unconsolidated undrained Test is performed with the drain valve closed for all the phases of the test.
artciles.description: Water is not allowed to drain.

artciles.q:
In which test drainage is allowed during cell pressure application. 
                  Then without allowing further drainage, deviator stress is increased keeping cell pressure constant.
artciles.description: None

artciles.q: Filter paper drains may be provided around the outside of the specimen.
artciles.description: True,in order to speed up the consolidation process.

artciles.q: In a consolidated drained test, the total stress is equal to the effective stress.
artciles.description: Since the excess pore water pressure is zero.

artciles.q:
deviator stress is increased, drainage is permitted. The rate of loading must be 
                  slow enough to ensure no excess pore water pressure develops.
artciles.description: None

artciles.q: In triaxial compression test on a soil specimen the intermediate principle stress isequal to
artciles.description: None

artciles.q: In which stage a soil sample is set in the triaxial cell and confining pressure is then applied.
artciles.description: None

artciles.q: During which stage the applied stresses, axial strain, and pore water pressure or change in sample volume can be measured?
artciles.description: During both the stages, the applied stresses, axial strain, and pore water pressure or change in sample volume can be measured.

artciles.q: Which of the following are not a part of triaxial cell?
artciles.description: Both are a part of triaxial cell.

artciles.q: The connection  to  the  drainage  is  kept  open  for  complete  drainage in consolidated test.
artciles.description:
The connection  to  the  drainage  is  kept  open  for  
                              complete  drainage  so  that becomes  nu(c) equal  to  zero.

artciles.q:
If the unconfined compressive strength of a clay sample is 1800 psf,what will be the cohesion of the clay when it is tested
                  in Unconfined compression?
artciles.description: None

artciles.q:
If in a C-U triaxial test on stiff clay confining pressure=10 psi,the axial stress=30 psi,and the pore water pressure=5 psi at
            failure ,then the deviator stress at failure was 25 psi.
artciles.description: The deviator stress would be 20 psi.

artciles.q: The fundamental property of clay soil that is the basis for it's undrained shear strength is
artciles.description: Cohesion is responsible for undrained shear strength of a clay soil.
